headline: OVP(DE), high starting salary point, low increasing rate
status:
24 October 2020
"OVP(DE), high starting salary point, low increasing rate"
2.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros:
- The colleagues in low and middle level are friendly
- The comradery level is huge
- The salary starting point is high and generous
cons:
- Salary increasing rate is horrendously low
- Personnel in the manger level are harsh and mean
- VP is caring expenses very much
- Lack of support and resources
- The office is low-tech while working on a project related to IT education in primary schools
- Terrible communication between middle level and management level
advice_to_mgmt:
- Salary incresing rate should be higher
- Be realistic, don't just stay in the ivory tower, look into the real job market
- Be more generous on the expenses and working hour
- Input more on high-tech equipment

headline: don't come here
pros:
nice mix of asian and western academics and culture at the university
cheap (by HK standards) canteen if you like asian food.
cons:
so many.... 
- Feels like a fortress with all the security measures.
- No care by the university towards the students during the protests
- Almost no sporting facilities
- No campus life outside work/study, no cafes/bars/events 
- Terrible weather and very hilly terrain make for so much sweating, some of the buildings are really far from the mtr, why isn't there a shuttle bus??
- Seems really hard to meet and socialise with other staff and students at the university
advice_to_mgmt: listen to what the students want.

headline: Good pay amidst questionable management
status:
20 April 2020
"Good pay amidst questionable management"
3.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: The pay is good when compared to universities in other countries.
cons:
The management focused on traditional journal impact factors, thus developed indicators unfair to new and emerging disciplines. If you are working on an old discipline and published in IF >4 journals you will do well here. But if you aspires to establish yourself in a new area, and published conferences, books, and new journals, you will find little support here.

Also that the management seldom consults its faculties before deploying new policies. Most policies were discussed behind closed door and decreed university wide.
advice_to_mgmt: Promote good researchers from emerging disciplines into the core management team. Look at citation counts across all publications, not just journal IF, in measuring research rigor.

headline: Amazing Workplace
pros: No pressure of work whatsoever the case may be. Excellent place to excel in the academic career. Faculty is very intelligent, innovative and always want to get something innovative out of you.
cons: Even though you perform exceptionally well, you are not allowed to pursue your academic career as faculty after getting your highest degree. You need to go out of the Hong Kong to get some useful experience and then you should come back.
advice_to_mgmt: At least the management needs to increase the salaries of the staff according to the pay scale of the industrial level so as to maintain a good financial balance between the academics and industry.

headline: Limiting
pros:
- boss is good
- colleagues are friendly
- interesting work
- good restaurants
cons:
- no career advancement opportunities 
-no funding of junior research staff for conferences unlike other universities.
- don’t bother applying if you cannot get at least an Assistant Professorship in CityU. Anything below is a waste of time.
- lower salary than HKUST or HKU and even CUHK. 
- miserable annual leave allowance (1 day per month if you are contract staff)
- admin workload is dumped onto research staff. Best ever : they asked for ‘volunteers’ to get free manpower.
- no space. 
- expected to get own funding to publish papers but refuses to let junior staff be a PI - please go to point 1 again
